NIH.title: NIH Game System
NIH.AbilityUseHint: Configure how you would like to use the {name} {type}.
NIH.AbilityUseUnavailableHint: There are no uses of this item remaining!
NIH.AbilityUseChargedHint: This {type} is charged and ready to use!
NIH.AbilityUseRechargeHint: This {type} is depleted and must be recharged!
NIH.AbilityUseNormalHint: This {type} has {value} of {max} uses per {per} remaining.
NIH.AbilityUseConsumableChargeHint: Using this {type} will consume 1 charge of {value} remaining.
NIH.AbilityUseConsumableQuantityHint: Using this {type} will consume 1 quantity of {quantity} remaining
NIH.AbilityUseConsumableDestroyHint: Using this {type} will consume its final charge and it will be destroyed.
NIH.AbilityConfigure: Configure Ability Checks and Saving Throws
NIH.AbilityConfigurationHint: Configure ability saving throw proficiency, saving throw bonuses, and check bonuses.
NIH.AbilityCheckGlobalBonusHint: This bonus applies to all ability checks made by this actor.
NIH.ActionWarningNoItem: The requested item {item} no longer exists on Actor {name}
NIH.ActionWarningNoToken: You must have one or more controlled Tokens in order to use this option.
NIH.ActorWarningInvalidItem: {itemType} items cannot be added to a {actorType}.
NIH.ActiveEffectOverrideWarning: This value is being modified by an Active Effect and cannot be edited. Disable the effect to edit it.
NIH.AddEmbeddedItemPromptHint: Do you want to add these items to your character sheet?
NIH.AdvancementAbilityScoreImprovementHi: Allow the player to increase one or more ability scores or take an optional feat.
NIH.AdvancementAbilityScoreImprovementFe: Drop a feat here to choose one instead of an ability score improvement.
Only features with the 'feat' type can be selected.
NIH.AdvancementAbilityScoreImprovementLo: Scores cannot be modified with a feat selected.
NIH.AdvancementAbilityScoreImprovementPo: Number of points that can be assigned to any ability score below the maximum that doesn't have a fixed improvement set.
NIH.AdvancementConfigureAllowDropsHint: Should players be able to drop their own choices into this advancement?
NIH.AdvancementConfigureDropAreaHint: Drop Items here to add them to the pool from which a player can choose.
NIH.AdvancementDeleteConfirmationMessage: Deleting this item will also delete all advancement choices made for it. These changes will be removed from your character as long as the checkbox below is checked.
NIH.AdvancementFlowDropAreaHint: Drop an Item here to choose it.
NIH.AdvancementHitPointsHint: Track the player's hit points for each level in the class.
NIH.AdvancementHitPointsEmptyError: Hit points must be rolled or the average value must be taken.
NIH.AdvancementHitPointsInvalidError: Hit points must be a valid whole number.
NIH.AdvancementItemChoiceHint: Present the player with a choice of items (such as equipment, features, or spells) that they can choose for their character at one or more levels.
NIH.AdvancementItemChoiceLevelsHint: Specify how many choices are allowed at each level.
NIH.AdvancementItemChoicePreviouslyChose: This item has already been chosen at a previous level.
NIH.AdvancementItemChoiceSpellLevelAvail: Only {level} or lower spells can be chosen for this advancement.
NIH.AdvancementItemChoiceSpellLevelSpeci: Only {level} spells can be chosen for this advancement.
NIH.AdvancementItemChoiceSpellLevelHint: Only allow choices from spells of this level.
NIH.AdvancementItemChoiceTypeHint: Restrict what Item types can be choosen.
NIH.AdvancementItemChoiceTypeWarning: Only {type} items can be selected for this choice.
NIH.AdvancementItemGrantHint: Grant the character items (such as equipment, features, or spells) when they reach a certain level.
NIH.AdvancementItemGrantDropHint: Drop Items here to add them to the list granted by this advancement.
NIH.AdvancementItemGrantDuplicateWarning: That item already exists on this advancement.
NIH.AdvancementItemGrantRecursiveWarning: You cannot grant an item in its own advancement.
NIH.AdvancementItemGrantOptionalHint: If optional, players will be given the option to opt out of any of the following items, otherwise all of them are granted.
NIH.AdvancementItemTypeInvalidWarning: {type} items cannot be added with this advancement type.
NIH.AdvancementLevelDownConfirmationMess: Leveling this class down will also undo all advancement choices made for it. These changes will be removed from your character as long as the checkbox below is checked.
NIH.AdvancementManagerCloseMessage: If the advancement process is cancelled, choices made so far will be discarded and no changes will be made to the actor.
NIH.AdvancementManagerRestartConfirm: Are you sure you wish to undo all choices so far?
NIH.AdvancementMigrationHint: Select which of the following advancements will be added to {name}.
NIH.AdvancementScaleValueHint: A single value that changes as a class increases in level that is made available in roll formulas (such as a Monk's martial arts die).
NIH.AdvancementScaleValueIdentifierHint: This scale value for the current level will be available using @scale.{class}.{identifier} in a formula.
NIH.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintCR: Use this for representing creature challenge ratings for features like Wild Shape.
NIH.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintDice: Use this for dice values like bardic inspiration, sneak attack, or superiority dice.
NIH.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintDistanc: Use this for numerical values that represent a distance, such as unarmored movement speed, or aura of protection radius.
NIH.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintNumber: Use this for purely numerical values like rage damage bonus or number of uses per day.
NIH.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintString: Use this if you are unsure of the type of the scale values, or if the type does not matter.
NIH.ArmorConfigHint: Fill in the above box to override automatically calculated armor class.
NIH.BonusesHint: Define global bonuses as formulas which are added to certain rolls. For example: 1d4 + 2
NIH.BonusesInstructions: Configure character bonuses which are added to the appropriate dice roll
NIH.ClassIdentifierHint: This class's data will be accessible using @classes.{identifier} in roll formulas.
NIH.ClassMakeOriginalHint: First class taken by character used to determine certain class traits when multiclassing.
NIH.ConsumeWarningNoResource: {name} is designated to consume {type} but no resource is specified!
NIH.ConsumeWarningNoSource: The designated {type} source that {name} consumes no longer exists!
NIH.ConsumeWarningNoQuantity: {name} has run out of its designated {type}!
NIH.ConsumeWarningZeroAttribute: {name} has run out of its designated attribute resource pool!
NIH.ConsumableLastChargeWarn: This is the last charge of this unit and consuming it will also reduce the item's quantity by 1
NIH.CurrencyConvertHint: Convert all carried currency to the highest possible denomination to reduce the amount of coinage carried by the character. Be wary, this action cannot be undone.
NIH.DamagePhysicalBypassHint: These weapon properties will bypass damage resistance for physical damage.
NIH.DeathSaveCriticalSuccess: {name} critically succeeded on a death saving throw and has regained 1 Hit Point!
NIH.DeathSaveSuccess: {name} has survived with 3 death save successes and is now stable!
NIH.DeathSaveFailure: {name} has died with 3 death save failures!
NIH.DeathSaveUnnecessary: You do not need to roll death saves because you have a positive number of hit points or have already reached 3 successes or failures.
NIH.EffectUnavailableInfo: Source item must be equipped or attuned to activate these
NIH.FilterNoSpells: No spells found for this set of filters.
NIH.NoSpellLevels: This character has no spellcaster levels, but you may add spells manually.
NIH.FlagsInstructions: Configure character features and traits which fine-tune behaviors of the NIH system.
NIH.FlagsDiamondSoulHint: Gain proficiency to all saving throws.
NIH.FlagsElvenAccuracyHint: Roll an extra d20 with advantage to Dex, Int, Wis, or Cha.
NIH.FlagsHalflingLuckyHint: Reroll ones when rolling d20 checks.
NIH.FlagsInitiativeAdvHint: Provided by feats or magical items.
NIH.FlagsJOATHint: Half-Proficiency to Ability Checks in which you are not already Proficient.
NIH.FlagsObservantHint: Provides a +5 to passive Perception and Investigation.
NIH.FlagsRemarkableAthleteHint: Half-Proficiency (rounded-up) to physical Ability Checks and Initiative.
NIH.FlagsWeaponCritThresholdHint: An expanded critical hit threshold for weapon attacks.
NIH.FlagsSpellCritThresholdHint: An expanded critical hit threshold for spell attacks.
NIH.FlagsMeleeCriticalDiceHint: A number of additional damage dice added to melee weapon critical hits.
NIH.FormulaMissingReferenceWarn: The {property} formula within {name} has references to missing data: {references}
NIH.HPFormulaError: The provided hit point formula could not be evaluated.
NIH.HitDiceConfigHint: Adjust remaining hit dice levels for each class.
NIH.HitDiceWarn: {name} has no available {formula} Hit Dice remaining!
NIH.IdentifierError: Identifier can only contain letters (a-z), numbers (0-9), dashes (-), and underscores (_).
NIH.InitiativeConfigHint: Configure initiative modifiers and bonuses which apply to this Actor.
NIH.ItemRecoveryFormulaWarning: Unable to recover charges for {name}. Invalid recovery formula '{formula}'.
NIH.LongRestHint: Take a long rest? On a long rest you will recover hit points, half your maximum hit dice, class resources, limited use item charges, and spell slots.
NIH.LongRestResult: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {health} Hit Points and {dice} Hit Dice.
NIH.LongRestResultHitDice: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {dice} Hit Dice.
NIH.LongRestResultHitPoints: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {health} Hit Points.
NIH.MaxCharacterLevelExceededWarn: Character cannot be advanced past level {max}.
NIH.MaxClassLevelExceededWarn: Class cannot be advanced past level {max}.
NIH.MaxClassLevelMinimumWarn: Class must have at least one level.
NIH.ModuleArtConfigH: Configure which module-provided art should be used.
NIH.Name: Character Name
NIH.PolymorphKeepAE: Keep all effects (overrides other effect retention options).
NIH.PolymorphKeepBackgroundAE: Keep effects that originate from your background?
NIH.PolymorphKeepClass: Keep proficiency bonus (leaves class items in sheet)
NIH.PolymorphKeepClassAE: Keep effects that originate from your class or subclass?
NIH.PolymorphKeepEquipmentAE: Keep effects that originate from your equipment?
NIH.PolymorphKeepFeatureAE: Keep effects that originate from your features?
NIH.PolymorphKeepMental: Keep mental ability scores (Int, Wis, Cha)
NIH.PolymorphKeepOriginAE: Keep effects that originate from this actor (i.e. effects not attached to features, items, spells)
NIH.PolymorphKeepOtherOriginAE: Keep effects that originate from a different actor?
NIH.PolymorphKeepPhysical: Keep physical ability scores (Str, Dex, Con)
NIH.PolymorphKeepSelf: Keep self (just change image and size i.e. for spells like Disguise Self)
NIH.PolymorphKeepSpellAE: Keep effects that originate from your spells?
NIH.PolymorphMergeSaves: Merge saving throw proficiencies (take the highest)
NIH.PolymorphRevertNoOriginalActorWarn: No original actor was found with reference '{reference}'
NIH.PolymorphRevertWarn: You do not have permission to revert this Actor's polymorphed state.
NIH.PolymorphWarn: You are not allowed to polymorph this actor!
NIH.MovementConfigHint: Configure movement speed and special movement attributes.
NIH.NewDayHint: Recover limited use abilities which recharge "per day"?
NIH.SaveGlobalBonusHint: This bonus applies to all saving throws made by this actor.
NIH.SensesConfigHint: Configure any special sensory perception abilities that this actor possesses.
NIH.ShortRestHint: Take a short rest? On a short rest you may spend remaining Hit Dice and recover primary or secondary resources.
NIH.ShortRestResult: {name} takes a short rest spending {dice} Hit Dice to recover {health} Hit Points.
NIH.SkillGlobalBonusCheckHint: This bonus applies to all skill checks made by this actor.
NIH.SpellCastNoSlots: You have no available {level} spell slots with which to cast {name}
NIH.SubclassIdentifierHint: This identifier should match the identifier on the parent class to ensure they are properly linked.
NIH.SubclassAssignmentError: {class} already has a subclass. Remove the existing '{subclass}' subclass before adding a new one.
NIH.SubclassDuplicateError: A subclass with the identifier {identifier} already exists on this actor.
NIH.SubclassMismatchWarn: {name} subclass has no matching class with identifier '{class}'.
NIH.VehicleActionsHint: Actions taken with full crew complement
NIH.WarnBadACFormula: The provided AC formula could not be evaluated.
NIH.WarnCantAddMultipleAdvancements: It is not currently possible to add multiple items with advancements to an actor at the same time. Please add them individually.
NIH.WarnMultipleArmor: More than one suit of armor equipped, AC calculation may be incorrect.
NIH.WarnMultipleShields: More than one shield equipped, AC calculation may be incorrect.
NIH.description: A system for playing the fifth edition of the worlds most popular roleplaying game in the Foundry Virtual Tabletop environment.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.NIH.Class.AdditionalEqu: List of equipment granted by this class if taken at first level.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.NIH.Class.AdditionalHit: Additional descriptive text displayed beneath the auto-generated hit points section.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.NIH.Class.AdditionalTra: List of proficiencies granted by this class.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.NIH.Class.DescriptionHi: Primary description of the class that will appear first.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.NIH.Class.FeaturesDescr: As a {lowercaseName}, you gain the following class features, which are summarized in the {name} table.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.NIH.Class.HitPointsLeve: Hit Points at 1st Level: {max} + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: {dice} (or {average}) + your Constitution modifier per {class} level after 1st
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.NIH.Class.NoValidClass: No valid class selected, press the edit button to add a class.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.NIH.Class.OptionalFeatu: The following section contains options {class} features. These features are not granted automatically, and you can choose one, some, or all of them at your DM's discretion.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.NIH.Class.SubclassDescr: Introduction that will be displayed before this class's subclasses.
MACRO.5eMissingTargetWarn: Your controlled actor '{actor}' does not have an {type} with name '{name}'.
MACRO.5eMultipleTargetsWarn: Your controlled actor '{actor}' has more than one {type} with name '{name}'. The first match will be chosen.
MACRO.5eNoActorSelected: No selected or assigned actor could be found to target with macro.
MACRO.5eUnownedWarn: You can only create macro buttons for owned Items
MIGRATION.5eBegin: Applying NIH System Migration for version {version}. Please be patient and do not close your game or shut down your server.
MIGRATION.5eComplete: NIH System Migration to version {version} completed!
MIGRATION.5eVersionTooOldWarning: Your NIH system data is from too old a Foundry version and cannot be reliably migrated to the latest version. The process will be attempted, but errors may occur.
SETTINGS.5eAllowPolymorphingL: Allow players to polymorph their own actors.
SETTINGS.5eAutoCollapseCardL: Automatically collapse Item Card descriptions in the Chat Log
SETTINGS.5eAutoSpellTemplateL: When a spell is cast, defaults to begin the process to create the corresponding Measured Template if any (requires TRUSTED or higher player role)
SETTINGS.5eCriticalMaxDiceL: Make critical hits more deadly by maximizing the values of base damage dice.
SETTINGS.5eCriticalModifiersL: Make critical hits more deadly by multiplying non-dice modifiers in addition to rolled dice.
SETTINGS.5eCurWtL: Carried currency affects character encumbrance following the rules on PHB pg. 143.
SETTINGS.5eDiagL: Configure which diagonal movement rule should be used for games within this system.
SETTINGS.5eFeatsL: Allow players to choose a feat rather than taking an ability score improvement during class advancement.
SETTINGS.5eHonorL: Enable the use of the optional Honor ability score. Requires the world to be reloaded.
SETTINGS.5eInitTBL: Append the raw Dexterity ability score to break ties in Initiative.
SETTINGS.5eMetricL: Replaces all reference to lbs with kgs and updates the encumbrance calculations to use metric weight units.
SETTINGS.5eNoAdvancementsL: Do not prompt for level-up or character creation choices.
SETTINGS.5eNoExpL: Remove experience bars from character sheets.
SETTINGS.5eProfL: Configure proficiency modifier to use a fixed bonus or a dice roll. Reloading the world is required for this change to take effect.
SETTINGS.5eRestL: Configure which rest variant should be used for games within this system.
SETTINGS.5eSanityL: Enable the use of the optional Sanity ability score. Requires the world to be reloaded.
